docs.lead_paragraph: Imagine that those running for office tailored their economic positions to attract the experts in the field. What would it take to put the nation’s economists solidly behind a candidate?

headline.main: What if the Candidates Pandered to Economists?
headline.print_headline: What if the Candidates Pandered to Economists?

docs.snippet: Imagine that those running for office tailored their economic positions to attract the experts in the field. What would it take to put the nation’s economists solidly behind a candidate?

docs.lead_paragraph: ''Half of the uninsured people in our state are working for small business.'' Nancy Wyman, state comptroller for Connecticut. States are trying different approaches to help small businesses unable to afford health insurance for their employees.

docs.lead_paragraph: Neither party in this presidential campaign has been forthright with the public about the true extent of the crises facing the country.

docs.lead_paragraph: Constant fund-raising within a universe of rich donors can distance a candidate from the needy he professes to empathize with.

docs.lead_paragraph: Are private fee-for-service plans under Medicare Advantage really that bad? Yes.
docs.abstract: Are private fee-for-service plans under Medicare Advantage really that bad? Yes. Good explanation of what really went down in the Senate here. docs.lead_paragraph: Normally conservative investors like insurance companies and pension funds are starting to hunt for bargains in the loans used to finance private equity deals, The New York Post reported, suggesting that the credit crunch is beginning to ease for troubled investment banks.

headline.main: Buyers Said to Emerge for Leveraged Loans

docs.lead_paragraph: The union local representing striking concrete truck drivers in New York City announced on Thursday night that it had reached a tentative contract with the city’s concrete producers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fewer people signed up for unemployment benefits last week, but the drop was not enough to overcome continuing weakness in the country’s labor market.
